name: fortinet-fortisase
label: Fortinet FortiSASE
description: FortiSASE is a cloud-delivered security service edge (SSE) solution that provides always-on secure access to private applications. This connector facilitates automated operations to manage services, hosts, host groups, and policies.

fields.name: server
fields.title: Server URL
fields.tooltip: Specify the URL of the FortiSASE server to connect and perform automated operations. To find the url of the FortiSASE server, navigate to the FortiSASE portal and copy the URL from the address bar of the browser.
fields.description: Specify the URL of the FortiSASE server to connect and perform automated operations.

fields.title: Authentication Method
fields.name: auth_method
fields.description: Select the authentication method. You can choose from the following options: Username/Password (Default), Token.

Username/Password.title: Username
Username/Password.name: username
Username/Password.description: Username to access the Fortinet FortiSASE server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
Username/Password.tooltip: Username to access the Fortinet FortiSASE server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

Username/Password.title: Password
Username/Password.name: password
Username/Password.description: Password to access the Fortinet FortiSASE server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
Username/Password.tooltip: Password to access the Fortinet FortiSASE server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

Username/Password.title: Client ID
Username/Password.name: client_id
Username/Password.description: Client to access the Fortinet FortiSASE server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
Username/Password.tooltip: Client ID to access the Fortinet FortiSASE server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

Token.title: Token
Token.name: token
Token.description: Authorization token to access the Fortinet FortiSASE server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
Token.tooltip: Authorization token to access the Fortinet FortiSASE server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description:
Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified.
By default, this option is selected, i.e., set to true.

operations.title: Get Service
operations.description: Retrieves a service based on the service name you have specified.

parameters.name: service_name
parameters.title: Service Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the service to retrieve.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the service to retrieve.

operations.title: Get Services List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all services.

operations.title: Create Service
operations.description: Creates a new service based on the primary key, category, protocol and TCP port range you have specified.

parameters.title: Primary Key
parameters.description: Specify the unique identifier for the service that you want to create.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the unique identifier for the service that you want to create.
parameters.name: primaryKey

parameters.title: Category
parameters.description: Specify the category that you want to assign to the service you want to create.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the category that you want to assign to the service you want to create.
parameters.name: category

parameters.title: Protocol
parameters.description: Specify the protocol used by the service you want to create.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the protocol used by the service you want to create.
parameters.name: protocol

parameters.title: TCP Port Range
parameters.description: Specify the TCP port range that you want to assign to the service you want to create.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the TCP port range that you want to assign to the service you want to create.
parameters.name: tcpPortrange

operations.title: Delete Service
operations.description: Deletes a service based on the primary key you have specified.

parameters.title: Primary Key
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the service to delete.
parameters.tooltip: Unique identifier of the service to delete.
parameters.name: primaryKey

operations.title: Get Host
operations.description: Retrieves a host based on the host name you have specified.

parameters.title: Host Name
parameters.name: host_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the host to retrieve.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the host to retrieve.

operations.title: Create Host
operations.description: Creates a new host based on the host name, type and location you have specified.

parameters.title: Host Name
parameters.description: Specify the unique identifier for the host that you want to create.
parameters.name: primaryKey

validation.patternError: Host name must be 1-79 characters and match the pattern: ^[\w<>()#"\]\s-]{1,79}$

parameters.title: Host Type
parameters.description: Select the type of the host that you want to create. You can choose from the following options: "IP Mask" (Default), "IP Range", "FQDN", "Geography"
parameters.name: type

IP Mask.title: Subnet
IP Mask.description: Subnet of the host (required for ipmask type)
IP Mask.name: subnet

validation.patternError: Subnet must be a valid IPv4 CIDR notation

IP Range.title: Start IP
IP Range.description: Start IP address (required for iprange type)
IP Range.name: startIp

validation.patternError: Start IP must be a valid IPv4 address

IP Range.title: End IP
IP Range.description: End IP address (required for iprange type)
IP Range.name: endIp

validation.patternError: End IP must be a valid IPv4 address

FQDN.title: FQDN
FQDN.description: Fully Qualified Domain Name (required for fqdn type)
FQDN.name: fqdn

validation.patternError: FQDN must be a valid domain name (1-255 characters)

Geography.title: Country ID
Geography.description: Two-letter country code (required for geography type)
Geography.name: countryId

validation.patternError: Country ID must be a two-letter country code

parameters.title: Location
parameters.description: Select the location of the host that you want to create. You can choose from the following options: "Internal", "External", "Private Access", "Unspecified" (Default)
parameters.name: location

operations.title: Delete Host
operations.description: Deletes a host based on the primary key you have specified.

parameters.title: Primary Key
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the service to delete.
parameters.tooltip: Unique identifier of the service to delete.
parameters.name: primaryKey

operations.title: Create To Hub Policy
operations.description: Creates a new To Hub policy based on the policy configuration you have specified.

parameters.title: Policy Configuration
parameters.description: Specify the full configuration of the To Hub policy that you want to create.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the full configuration of the To Hub policy that you want to create.
parameters.name: policy_config

operations.title: Create From Hub Policy
operations.description: Creates a new From Hub policy based on the policy configuration you have specified.

parameters.title: Policy Configuration
parameters.description: Specify the full configuration of the From Hub policy that you want to create.
parameters.name: policy_config

operations.title: Generic API Call
operations.description: Make a generic API call to Fortinet FortiSASE

parameters.name: method
parameters.title: HTTP Method
parameters.description: The HTTP method for the API call (e.g., GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)

parameters.name: data
parameters.title: Request Data
parameters.description: JSON data to send with the request (for POST, PUT methods)
